member.name: T:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.BrandesFastCentralityCalculator
member.summary: Calculates the betweenness and closeness centralities for each of the graph's vertices.
member.remarks:
If a vertex is isolated, its betweenness and closeness centralities are zero.
In a previous version, the centralities were calculated simultaneously by this class using the algorithm described in the paper "A Faster Algorithm for Betweenness Centrality," by Ulrik Brandes. The paper can be found here:
http://www.inf.uni-konstanz.de/algo/publications/b-fabc-01.pdf
Section 4 of the paper explains how other centrality measures can be computed within the same algorithm at little additional cost. That is why closeness centrality was calculated by this class along with betweenness.
Starting with version 1.0.1.122 of NodeXL, the centralities are calculated using the SNAP graph library, which is much faster than the previous NodeXL code. SNAP calculates betweenness and closeness centralities separately, so it might make sense to split this class in two in a future release. Or would it make more sense to modify SNAP to calculate the two simultaneously, as suggested by Brandes?

member.name: M:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.GraphMetricCalculatorBase.SetSnapGraphMetricCalculatorPath(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the path to the executable that calculates graph metrics using the SNAP library.
member.param: Full path to the executable. Sample: "C:\MyProgram\SnapGraphMetricCalculator.exe".
member.remarks:
Some of the derived classes use a separate executable to do their graph metric calculations. This executable, which is custom built for NodeXL, uses the SNAP library created by Jure Leskovec at Stanford. The SNAP code is written in C++ and is optimized for speed and scalability, so it can calculate certain graph metrics much faster than could be done in C# code.
By default, the NodeXL build process copies the executable, which is named SnapGraphMetricCalculator.exe, to the Algorithm project's output directory, which is either bin\Debug or bin\Release. Also by default, derived classes look for this executable in the same folder as the Algorithm assembly. That means that for many projects, the executable will be automatically found and this method does not need to be called.
If your application's deployment places the executable somewhere else, however, you must call this static method once to provide the derived classes with the executable's path.

member.name: T:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.ClusterAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the algorithm used to partition a graph into clusters.

member.name: F:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.ClusterAlgorithm.WakitaTsurumi
member.summary: Use the Wakita-Tsurumi cluster algorithm.
member.remarks:
The algorithm is described in "Finding Community Structure in Mega-scale Social Networks," by Ken Wakita and Toshiyuki Tsurumi. The paper can be found here:
http://arxiv.org/PS_cache/cs/pdf/0702/0702048v1.pdf
NodeXL implements the data structure described in section 4.1 of the paper. It does not implement the heuristics described in section 4.2.

member.name: F:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.ClusterAlgorithm.GirvanNewman
member.summary: Use the Girvan-Newman cluster algorithm.
member.remarks:
The algorithm is described in "Community Structure in Social and Biological Networks," by Michelle Girvan and M. E. J. Newman. The paper can be found here:
http://www.santafe.edu/media/workingpapers/01-12-077.pdf
This algorithm is implemented by the SNAP graph library.

member.name: F:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.ClusterAlgorithm.ClausetNewmanMoore
member.summary: Use the Clauset-Newman-Moore algorithm.
member.remarks:
The algorithm is descibed in "Finding Community Structure in Very Large Networks," by Aaron Clauset, M. E. J. Newman, and Cristopher Moore. The paper can be found here:
http://www.ece.unm.edu/ifis/papers/community-moore.pdf
This algorithm is implemented by the SNAP graph library.

member.name: F:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.ClusterAlgorithm.Clique
member.summary: Use an algorithm that partitions a graph into cliques.

Set the property to true to put the graph's neighborless vertices into one cluster.
IMPORTANT NOTE: If is true, removes any neighborless vertices from the graph that is passed to it.

member.overloads: Calculates a set of strongly connected components.
member.summary: Calculates the strongly connected components for a specified graph.
member.param: Graph to get the strongly connected components for.
true to sort the components by increasing vertex count, false to sort them by decreasing vertex count.
member.returns: A list of LinkedLists of vertices. Each LinkedList of vertices comprises a strongly connected component of the graph. The components are sorted into groups by vertex count, in the order specified by . If the key is set on the graph, then the components within each group are further sorted by the smallest value on the vertices within each component.
member.remarks:
This method uses Tarjan's strongly connected components algorithm, outlined here:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ Tarjan%27s_strongly_connected_components_algorithm

member.name: T:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.OneSnapGraphMetricCalculatorBase
member.summary: Calculates one per-vertex graph metric using the SNAP graph library.
member.remarks:
This is a base class for several classes that use the SNAP graph library to calculate one per-vertex graph metric in the enumeration. "Per-vertex" means that a metric is computed for each vertex in the graph, as opposed to "per-graph," for which there is a single metric value for the entire graph.
If a vertex is isolated, its metric value is zero.

member.summary: Calculate the graph metrics.

A collection of objects, one for each group.
true if the graph's directedness should be taken into account.

member.name: M:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.IntergroupEdgeCalculator.TryCalculateGraphMetrics(Smrf.NodeXL.Core.IGraph,System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Smrf.NodeXL.Core.GroupInfo},System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Smrf.NodeXL.Core.IntergroupEdgeInfo}@)
member.summary: Attempts to calculate the graph metrics while optionally running on a background thread.
member.param: The graph to calculate metrics for. The graph may contain duplicate edges and self-loops.
The BackgroundWorker whose thread is calling this method, or null if the method is being called by some other thread.
A collection of objects, one for each group.
true if the graph's directedness should be taken into account.

Where the graph metrics get stored if true is returned. There is one object in the collection for each pair of groups in that have edges between them, and one object for each group that has edges within it. Pairs of groups that do not have edges between them are not included in the collection, nor are groups that do not have edges within them. The collection is sorted first by , then by .
member.returns: true if the graph metrics were calculated, false if the user wants to cancel.
member.remarks:
If is false or the graph is undirected, all edges between groups A and B are returned in a single object.
If is true and the graph is directed, edges from group A to group B are returned in one object, and edges from group B to group A are returned in another object.

member.name: T:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.DConnectorMotif
member.summary: Represents a D-connector motif.
member.remarks:
See the enumeration for the definition of a D-connector motif. Note that a D-connector motif includes only its . The are provided by this class, but they are not actually a part of the motif.
This class is optimized for use by the algorithm that finds D-connector motifs. Because of that, it's possible to create an instance of this class that isn't actually a valid D-connector motif. Specifically, it's up to the caller to populate the collection, which starts out empty, with at least two span vertices.

member.name: T:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.Motifs
member.summary: Specifies one or more motif types.
member.remarks: The flags can be ORed together.

member.name: F:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.Motifs.None
member.summary: No motifs.

member.name: F:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.Motifs.Fan
member.summary: A fan motif consists of a head vertex and the edges connecting it to N>=2 leaf vertices that each have exactly one adjacent vertex. The head vertex, edges, and the leaf vertices are all part of the fan motif. We exclude the degenerate case of the "barbell" component with only two vertices and one edge.

member.name: F:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.Motifs.DConnector
member.summary: A D-connector motif consists of D anchor vertices, each connected to a set of N>=2 span vertices by span edges. The span vertices have exactly D adjacent vertices, which are the anchor vertices. The anchor vertices have at least N adjacent vertices, N of which are the span vertices.

member.name: F:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.Motifs.Clique
member.summary: A clique motif consists of a maximum set of vertices who have all possible ties present among themselves.

member.name: M:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.OverallReciprocationCalculator.CountEdges(Smrf.NodeXL.Core.IGraph,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.Int64}@,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.Int64}@)
member.summary: Counts edges in the graph.
member.param: The graph to calculate metrics for. The graph may contain duplicate edges and self-loops. It must be directed.

When the method returns, this will contain the unique concatenations of the vertex IDs for edges, where the order of vertex IDs is taken into account. If there are duplicate edges, they will get added to the HashSet once only.

When the method returns, this will contain the unique concatenations of the vertex IDs for edges, where the order of vertex IDs is NOT taken into account. If there are duplicate edges, they will get added to the HashSet once only.
member.remarks: This method ignores self-loops and duplicate edges.

member.name: T:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.ReciprocatedVertexPairRatioCalculator
member.summary: Calculates the reciprocated vertex pair ratio for each of the graph's vertices.
member.remarks:
The reciprocated vertex pair ratio for a vertex in a directed graph is the number of adjacent vertices the vertex is connected to with edges in both directions, divided by the number of adjacent vertices. It is not calculated for an undirected graph.
The calculations can handle self-loops, but they are rendered invalid if the graph has duplicate edges.

member.name: T:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.DuplicateEdgeDetector
member.summary: Counts duplicate and unique edges in a graph.
member.remarks:
The property on each of an edge's vertices is used to test for duplicate edges.
In a directed graph, (A,B) and (A,B) are considered duplicates. (A,B) and (B,A) are not duplicates.
In an undirected graph, (A,B) and (A,B) are considered duplicates. (A,B) and (B,A) are also duplicates.

member.name: M:Smrf.NodeXL.Algorithms.SubgraphCalculator.GetSubgraph(Smrf.NodeXL.Core.IVertex,System.Decimal,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{Smrf.NodeXL.Core.IVertex,System.Int32}@,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{Smrf.NodeXL.Core.IEdge}@)
member.summary: Gets a subgraph for a specified vertex.
member.param: Vertex to get a subgraph for.

The number of levels to go out from . Must be a multiple of 0.5. If 0, the subgraph includes just the vertex; if 1, it includes the vertex and its adjacent vertices; if 2, it includes the vertex, its adjacent vertices, and their adjacent vertices; and so on. The difference between N.5 and N.0 is that N.5 includes any edges connecting the outermost vertices to each other, whereas N.0 does not. 1.5, for example, includes any edges that connect the vertex's adjacent vertices to each other, whereas 1.0 includes only those edges that connect the adjacent vertices to the vertex.
true to get the subgraph's vertices and edges, false to get the subgraph's vertices only.
Where a Dictionary of subgraph vertices gets stored. The key is the IVertex and the value is the vertex's level, which is the distance of the subgraph vertex from .
Where a HashSet of subgraph edges gets stored. The key is the IEdge. If is false, the HashSet is always empty.
